Summary Note:
The RM was introduced to Koch Schmitz Müller at a corporate retreat in Berlin. They participated in team-building activities and developed a strong rapport, which eventually led to a successful business partnership.
Koch Schmitz Müller is a 44 year old CFO from Germany. He has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
Julius Baer's commitment to client satisfaction and innovative financial strategies convinced he to join.
Family Background: Koch Schmitz Müller is currently divorced. His children are named Schultz and Lorenz.
Education Background:
Koch graduated from Lessing-Gymnasium Frankfurt in 2000.
Koch completed his university studies at Leipzig Graduate School of Management in 2005.
Occupation History:
With a career spanning nearly 21 years, Koch Schmitz Müller has established himself as a key player in the industry.
Koch Schmitz Müller launched his career as a Family Office Manager at Deutsche Bank AG, where he gained valuable experience from 2004 to 2009.
He then transitioned to Dresdner Bank AG as a Investment Director, leveraging his expertise to drive results from 2011 to 2016.
At Berliner Sparkasse, he worked as a CFO from 2016 till now, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
Wealth Summary:
Throughout his career, he saved 260000 EUR, investing in various assets to grow his wealth.
He has condo located in Hamburg, worth 890000 EUR.


In addition to his career success, he also received an inheritance of 1220000 EUR from his late father, a renowned Stock Trader, in 2010.
Client Summary: Based on the information provided, we are excited about the client's financial journey and look forward to supporting him in achieving his financial goals.
